description: Birmingham City are to face Bradford City and Wrexham or Bolton Wanderers are to host Peterborough United in the EFL Trophy semi-finals.
title: EFL Trophy semi-final draw
title_page: EFL Trophy semi-final draw: Birmingham v Bradford; Wrexham or Bolton v Peterborough - BBC Sport
maintext:
Birmingham City will be at home to Bradford City - the sole League Two side remaining in the competition - in the semi-finals of the EFL Trophy.
In the other semi-final, Wrexham or Bolton Wanderers, who will meet in their quarter-final in north Wales on Tuesday, will be at home to holders Peterborough United.
League One leaders Birmingham are playing in the tournament for the first time since the 1994-95 season - when they won the trophy, defeating Carlisle United in the final at Wembley.
The first semi-final will be played in the week commencing 17 February, while the tie between Wrexham or Bolton and Pererborough will be played the following week.
The winners of the two semi-finals will play each other in the final at Wembley on 13 April.
